cyclone.name: BONNIE
cyclone.current_location: about 195 miles SSE of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest toward the central South Carolina coast, then forecast to slow, turn north-northeast and track along the North Carolina coast before exiting into the Atlantic mid-week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central South Carolina coast (near Charleston/Georgetown area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect (closest watch area is south of the port).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Savannah River GA to Little River Inlet SC.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Carolina and southeastern North Carolina coasts with eventual effects extending northward to the Virginia Capes.
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤9%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; most likely conditions are gusts 25–35 kt late Monday into Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the Virginia ports based on present forecast (surge guidance shows 1-2 ft only for SC coast).
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of rain could bring 1–2 inches across coastal Virginia Tuesday–Wednesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough surf and dangerous rip currents beginning Monday, possible minor coastal flooding during high-tide cycles.
